intro: Beloperone monopleurantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved beloperone, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four petals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists studying tropical flora.
